page.title: 06Screel Hill 2
page.content: conifers such as Sitka Spruce and Douglas Fir were being cultivated. These trees were all the property of the Forestry Commission who told us that in March 1985 a number of the Douglas firs had been cut down and added that more felling was planned for the month of August. Other vegetation grew on the rich peaty soil. We noticed gorse with its yellow flowers, ferns, tall grasses and different kinds of mosses such as spagnum moss, and litchen which grew on dykes and on tree trunks. Three quarters of the way to the top of the hill, the trees suddenly come to an end. The grass faded out too and thick bracken mixed with heather took its place. Close to the summit the ground became pure rock covered only by a little heather.
